                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' @param covariate_list named list of objects of class `Covariate` created

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' by `add_covariates()`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' This function allows the user to specify covariate adjustment details that will be included

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' as part of a simulation study. It is often of interest to compare several adjustment methods to

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#' no adjustment. To specify no adjustment, pass `NULL` as a list item to `covariate_list`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' @family simulation classes

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#' covariates <- sim_covariate_list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
#'   list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
#'     "No adjustment" = NULL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
#'     "Covariates 1 and 2" = add_covariates(c("cov1", "cov2"), normal_prior(0, 1000))

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
#'   )

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
#' )

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
sim_covariate_list <- function(covariate_list) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    11x
                    
                      
  covariate <- .sim_covariate_list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    11x
                    
                      
    covariate_list = covariate_list

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    6x
                    
                      
  covariate@guide <- data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    6x
                    
                      
    covariate_scenario = names(covariate@covariate_list)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    6x
                    
                      
  covariate

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
# show ----

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
setMethod(

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
  f = "show",

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
  signature = "SimCovariateList",

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
  definition = function(object) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    !
                    
                      
    cat("SimCovariateList object with ", NROW(object@covariate_list), " different scenario(s)\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    !
                    
                      
    if (NROW(object@covariate_list) <= 10) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    !
                    
                      
      print(object@guide)

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
)

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
# get_vars ----

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname get_vars

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      
#' @include generics.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
setMethod(

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
  f = "get_vars",

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
  signature = "SimCovariateList",

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
  definition = function(object) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    2x
                    
                      
    cov_cols <- if (!is.null(object@covariate_list)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    2x
                    
                      
      unlist(lapply(object@covariate_list, get_vars))

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
    } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    !
                    
                      
      NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    2x
                    
                      
    names(cov_cols) <- NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    2x
                    
                      
    return(cov_cols)

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
)

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' `LogisticBinaryOutcome` class

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' A class for defining a logistic regression with a binary outcome

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' to be translated to Stan code.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' Objects of class `LogisticBinaryOutcome` should not be created directly but by

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' the constructor [logistic_bin_outcome()].

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @slot function_stan_code character. stan function code block containing text to interpolate into stan model.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' Empty string for `LogisticBinaryOutcome`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @slot param_stan_code character. stan parameter code block containing text to interpolate into stan model.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' Empty string for `LogisticBinaryOutcome`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @slot likelihood_stan_code character. stan model likelihood code block containing text

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' to interpolate into stan model.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @slot n_param integer. Number of ancillary parameters for the model to estimate (0).

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @slot param_priors list. Named list of prior distributions on the ancillary parameters in the model.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' Empty for `LogisticBinaryOutcome`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @slot binary_var character. Variable used for outcome in `LogisticBinaryOutcome` objects.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @slot baseline_prior `Prior`. Object of class `Prior`

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' specifying prior distribution for the baseline outcome.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @include outcome_class.R helpers.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @family outcome

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
.logistic_bin_outcome <- setClass(

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
  "LogisticBinaryOutcome",

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
  contains = "BinaryOutcome",

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
  prototype = list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
    n_param = 0L,

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
    likelihood_stan_code =

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
      h_glue("

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
         for (i in 1:N) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
            target += bernoulli_logit_lupmf(y[i] | lp[i]) * weight[i];

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
         }")

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
  ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
  validity = function(object) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
    return(TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
)

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' Bernoulli distribution with logit parametrization

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' @param binary_var character. Name of binary (1/0 or TRUE/FALSE) outcome variable in the

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' model matrix

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' @param weight_var character. Optional name of variable in model matrix for weighting the log likelihood.

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' @param baseline_prior `Prior`. Object of class `Prior`

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' specifying prior distribution for the baseline outcome.

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' See `Details` for more information.

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' ## Baseline Prior

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' The `baseline_prior` argument specifies the prior distribution for the

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' baseline log odds. The interpretation of the `baseline_prior` differs

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#' slightly between methods selected in `borrowing_details()`:

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' - \emph{'BDB'}: the `baseline_prior` for Bayesian Dynamic Borrowing refers

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#' to the log odds of the external control arm.

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' - \emph{'Full borrowing'} or \emph{'No borrowing'}: the `baseline_prior` for

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#' these borrowing methods refers to the log odds for the

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#' internal control arm.

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Object of class [`LogisticBinaryOutcome`][LogisticBinaryOutcome-class].

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
#' @family outcome models

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
#' lg <- logistic_bin_outcome(

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
#'   binary_var = "response",

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
#'   baseline_prior = normal_prior(0, 1000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
#' )

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
logistic_bin_outcome <- function(binary_var,

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
                                 baseline_prior,

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
                                 weight_var = "") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    16x
                    
                      
  assert_string(binary_var)

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    15x
                    
                      
  assert_string(weight_var)

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    15x
                    
                      
  assert_class(baseline_prior, "Prior")

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    15x
                    
                      
  has_weight <- isTRUE(weight_var != "")

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    15x
                    
                      
  .logistic_bin_outcome(

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    15x
                    
                      
    binary_var = binary_var,

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    15x
                    
                      
    baseline_prior = baseline_prior,

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    15x
                    
                      
    weight_var = weight_var,

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    15x
                    
                      
    likelihood_stan_code = h_glue("

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    15x
                    
                      
      for (i in 1:N) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    15x
                    
                      
        target += bernoulli_logit_lupmf(y[i] | lp[i]){{weight}};

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
      }",

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    15x
                    
                      
      weight = if (has_weight) " * weight[i]" else ""

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
    ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    15x
                    
                      
    data_stan_code = h_glue("

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    15x
                    
                      
      array[N] int y;

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    15x
                    
                      
      {{weight}}",

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    15x
                    
                      
      weight = if (has_weight) "vector[N] weight;" else ""

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' `ExponentialSurvDist` Class

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' A class for defining a time-to-event survival analysis with an

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' exponential survival distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' Objects of class `ExponentialSurvDist` should not be created directly

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' but by the constructor [exp_surv_dist()].

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @slot function_stan_code character. stan function code block containing text to interpolate into stan model.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' Empty string for `ExponentialSurvDist`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @slot param_stan_code character. stan parameter code block containing text to interpolate into stan model.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' Empty string for `ExponentialSurvDist`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @slot likelihood_stan_code character. stan model likelihood code block containing text

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' to interpolate into stan model.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @slot n_param integer. Number of ancillary parameters for the model to estimate (0).

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @slot param_priors list. Named list of prior distributions on the ancillary parameters in the model.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' Empty for `ExponentialSurvDist`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @slot time_var character. Variable used for time in `TimeToEvent` objects.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @slot cens_var character. Variable used for censoring in `TimeToEvent` objects.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @slot baseline_prior `Prior`. Object of class `Prior`

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' specifying prior distribution for the baseline outcome.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @include outcome_class.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @family outcome

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
.exp_surv_dist <- setClass(

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
  "ExponentialSurvDist",

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
  contains = "TimeToEvent",

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
  prototype = list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
    n_param = 0L,

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
    likelihood_stan_code =

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
      h_glue("

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
         for (i in 1:N) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
            if (cens[i] == 1) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
               target += exponential_lccdf(time[i] | elp[i] );

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
            } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
               target += exponential_lpdf(time[i] | elp[i] );

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
            }

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
         }")

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
  ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
  validity = function(object) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
    return(TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' Exponential survival distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' @param time_var character. Name of time variable column in model matrix

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' @param cens_var character. Name of the censorship variable flag in model matrix

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' @param weight_var character. Optional name of variable in model matrix for weighting the log likelihood.

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' @param baseline_prior `Prior`. Object of class `Prior`

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#' specifying prior distribution for the baseline outcome.

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' See `Details` for more information.

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' ## Baseline Prior

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' The `baseline_prior` argument specifies the prior distribution for the

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#' baseline log hazard rate. The interpretation of the `baseline_prior` differs

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#' slightly between methods selected in `borrowing_details()`:

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
#' - \emph{'BDB'}: the `baseline_prior` for Bayesian Dynamic Borrowing refers

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
#' to the log hazard rate of the external control arm.

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
#' - \emph{'Full borrowing'} or \emph{'No borrowing'}: the `baseline_prior` for

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
#' these borrowing methods refers to the log hazard rate for the

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
#' internal control arm.

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Object of class [`ExponentialSurvDist`][ExponentialSurvDist-class].

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
#' @family outcome models

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
#' es <- exp_surv_dist(

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
#'   time_var = "time",

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
#'   cens_var = "cens",

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
#'   baseline_prior = normal_prior(0, 1000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
#' )

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
exp_surv_dist <- function(time_var, cens_var, baseline_prior, weight_var = "") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    43x
                    
                      
  assert_string(time_var)

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    42x
                    
                      
  assert_string(cens_var)

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    42x
                    
                      
  assert_string(weight_var)

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    42x
                    
                      
  assert_class(baseline_prior, "Prior")

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    42x
                    
                      
  has_weight <- isTRUE(weight_var != "")

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    42x
                    
                      
  .exp_surv_dist(

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    42x
                    
                      
    time_var = time_var,

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    42x
                    
                      
    cens_var = cens_var,

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    42x
                    
                      
    baseline_prior = baseline_prior,

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    42x
                    
                      
    weight_var = weight_var,

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    42x
                    
                      
    likelihood_stan_code =

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    42x
                    
                      
      h_glue("

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    42x
                    
                      
         for (i in 1:N) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    42x
                    
                      
            if (cens[i] == 1) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    42x
                    
                      
               target += exponential_lccdf(time[i] | elp[i] ){{weight}};

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
            } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    42x
                    
                      
               target += exponential_lpdf(time[i] | elp[i] ){{weight}};

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      
            }

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
         }",

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    42x
                    
                      
        weight = if (weight_var != "") " * weight[i]" else ""

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
      ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    42x
                    
                      
    data_stan_code = h_glue("

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    42x
                    
                      
      vector[N] time;

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    42x
                    
                      
      vector[N] cens;

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    42x
                    
                      
      {{weight}}",

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    42x
                    
                      
      weight = if (has_weight) "vector[N] weight;" else ""

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Specify Borrowing Model

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Specify type of borrowing and, for Bayesian Dynamic Borrowing,

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' set hyperprior for commensurability parameter tau.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @param method character. The type of borrowing to perform. It

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' must be one of: `'BDB'`, `'Full borrowing'`, or `'No borrowing'`. See _Details_ for

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' more information.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ext_flag_col character. The name of the column in

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' the data matrix that corresponds to the external control flag (`1`/`0` or

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' `TRUE`/`FALSE`). This identifies a patient as belonging to the external

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' control cohort.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @param tau_prior Object of class `Prior` defining the hyperprior on the

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' "commensurability parameter". See `Details` for more information.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' ## Method

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' The `method` argument specifies the type of borrowing that will be

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' implemented. There are currently three types of borrowing that are supported:

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' - \emph{'BDB'} for Bayesian Dynamic Borrowing. In Bayesian Dynamic

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' Borrowing, external control information is borrowed to the extent that the

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' outcomes (i.e., log hazard rates or log odds) are similar between

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' external and internal control populations. See

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' \href{https://doi.org/10.1002/pst.1589}{Viele et. al. 2014}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' - \emph{'Full borrowing'} for pooling of historical and concurrent controls.

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' There is no distinction between patients in the internal and external

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' control arms. While the `ext_flag_col` must still be specified, it is not

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' used.

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' - \emph{'No borrowing'} for evaluating only the internal comparison,

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' ignoring historical controls. Note that this method will filter the

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' model matrix based on values in `ext_flag_col`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' Though the ultimate model specification is the same for 'Full borrowing'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' and 'No borrowing', both are available as options to facilitate comparison

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' between methods.

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' ## External Control

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' The `ext_flag_col` argument refers to the column in the data matrix that

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' contains the flag indicating a patient is from the external control cohort.

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' While this column is not used in 'Full borrowing', it must still be

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' specified.

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' ## Tau Prior

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' The `tau_prior` argument specifies the hyperprior on the precision parameter

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#' commonly referred to as the commensurability parameter.

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' See \href{https://doi.org/10.1002/pst.1589}{Viele et. al. 2014} for more

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' details.

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#' This hyperprior determines (along with the comparability of the outcomes

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' between internal and external controls) how much borrowing of the external

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#' control group will be performed.

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' Example hyperpriors include largely uninformative inverse gamma distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#' \[e.g., `gamma_prior(alpha = .001, beta = .001)`\] as well as more

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#' informative distributions \[e.g., `gamma_prior(alpha = 1, beta = .001`)\],

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
#' though any distribution \eqn{x \in (0, \infty)} can be used. Distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
#' with more density at higher values of \eqn{x} (i.e., higher precision)

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
#' will lead to more borrowing.

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
#' @references Viele, K., Berry, S., Neuenschwander, B., Amzal, B., Chen, F.,

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
#'  Enas, N., Hobbs, B., Ibrahim, J.G., Kinnersley, N., Lindborg, S., Micallef,

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
#'   S., Roychoudhury, S. and Thompson, L. (2014),

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
#'   Use of historical control data for assessing treatment effects in clinical trials.

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
#'   __Pharmaceut. Statist., 13: 41--54__. \doi{10.1002/pst.1589}

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Object of class [`Borrowing`][Borrowing-class].

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
#' @include borrowing_class.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
#' sb <- borrowing_details(

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
#'   method = "BDB",

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
#'   ext_flag_col = "ext",

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
#'   tau_prior = gamma_prior(0.001, 0.001)

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
#' )

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
borrowing_details <- function(method,

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
                              ext_flag_col,

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
                              tau_prior = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
  # Additional checks and neater errors than in class definition

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    74x
                    
                      
  assert_choice(method, c("Full borrowing", "No borrowing", "BDB"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    73x
                    
                      
  assert_string(ext_flag_col)

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    71x
                    
                      
  if (method == "BDB") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    !
                    
                      
    if (is.null(tau_prior)) stop("When method='BDB', tau_prior must be specified")

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    39x
                    
                      
    assert_class(tau_prior, "Prior")

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    2x
                    
                      
    if (!parse_constraint(tau_prior)["lower"] >= 0) stop("tau distribution must be bounded >=0")

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    37x
                    
                      
    data_stan_code <- "matrix[N,2] Z;"

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
  } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    32x
                    
                      
    data_stan_code <- ""

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    69x
                    
                      
  .borrowing_class(

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    69x
                    
                      
    method = method,

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    69x
                    
                      
    ext_flag_col = ext_flag_col,

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    69x
                    
                      
    tau_prior = tau_prior,

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    69x
                    
                      
    data_stan_code = data_stan_code

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname mcmc_sample

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
setMethod(

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
  "mcmc_sample",

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
  signature = "ANY",

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
  definition = function(x, ...) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    2x
                    
                      
    stop(

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    2x
                    
                      
      "\nObjects of class `", paste0(class(x), collapse = "` / `"), "` not supported by `mcmc_sample()`.\n",

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    2x
                    
                      
      "For analyses on a single dataset, pass an object of class `Analysis` created by `create_analysis_obj()`.\n",

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    2x
                    
                      
      "For simulation analyses, pass an object of class `Simulation` created by `create_simulation_obj()`."

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
)

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' Sample from Stan model contained in `Analysis` object

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @param iter_warmup integer. The number of warm up iterations to run per chain.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' The default is 1000.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @param iter_sampling integer. The number of post-warm up iterations to run per chain.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' The default is 10000.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @param chains integer. The number of Markov chains to run. The default is 4.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @param verbose logical. Whether to print sampler updates (`TRUE`) or not

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' (`FALSE`)

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' @include create_analysis_obj.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname mcmc_sample

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @return An object of class `CmdStanMCMC`

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' ## Analysis objects

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' anls <- create_analysis_obj(

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'   data_matrix = example_matrix,

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'   covariates = add_covariates(

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'     covariates = c("cov1", "cov2"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#'     priors = normal_prior(0, 1000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#'   ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#'   outcome = weib_ph_surv_dist(

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#'     "time",

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#'     "cnsr",

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#'     shape_prior = normal_prior(0, 1000),

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#'     baseline_prior = normal_prior(0, 1000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#'   ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#'   borrowing = borrowing_details(

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#'     "BDB",

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#'     "ext",

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#'     exponential_prior(.001)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#'   ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#'   treatment = treatment_details("trt", normal_prior(0, 1000))

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' )

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#' mcmc_results <- mcmc_sample(anls)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
setMethod(

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
  "mcmc_sample",

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
  signature = "Analysis",

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
  definition = function(x,

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
                        iter_warmup = 1000L,

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
                        iter_sampling = 10000L,

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
                        chains = 4L,

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
                        verbose = FALSE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
                        ...) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
    # Input checks

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    1x
                    
                      
    assert_class(x, "Analysis")

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    1x
                    
                      
    assert_numeric(iter_warmup)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    1x
